security: Revealing the names of agents and their connections could expose them to danger and disrupt operations. "Following is a list of the agents known or probably known to ANETE-1...ANETE-1 was also aware of the persons with whom the staybehind funds are cached or stashed."
summary: A memo details the potential damage to CIA operations in Cuba following the arrest of ANETE-1, a principal agent, including exposure of agent networks and cached funds.
summary_one_paragraph: This secret memorandum, dated March 4, 1961, from Robert E. Gamberini (C/WH/L/FI) to the Chief of WH/4, assesses the damage to CIA operations resulting from the arrest of ANETE-1, a key agent in Cuba's stay-behind networks. The memo indicates that ANETE-1 had detailed knowledge of agent networks (including AMRIPE-1, AMARCH-1, and others), their contact methods, and cached funds, as well as connections to counter-revolutionaries, potentially compromising these assets and operations. The memo highlights the critical nature of ANETE-1's position and the breadth of sensitive information he possessed, necessitating a realistic appraisal of the operational fallout.
title: ARREST of ANETE-1 on 3 March 1961
